q1.question: What is the correct syntax to write an HTML comment?

q2.question: What is the function of the HTML style attribute?

choices.a: it is used to add style to an HTML element.
choices.b: it is use to uniquely identify specific styles of the element.

q2.answer: it is used to add style to an HTML element

q3.question: What is the effect of the <b> tag?

choices.a: it converts the text within it to bold.
choices.b: it is used to write black colored font.
choices.c: It is used to change the font size

q3.answer: it converts the text within it to bold.

q4.question: What is the select tag used for?

choices.b: Select some attributes and changes their styles.

q5.question: What is the smallest header in HTML by default?

q1.question: What is CSS?

choices.a: CSS is designed to separate the presentation and content, including layout, colors, and fonts
choices.b: CSS is the language used to style the HTML documents
choices.d: CSS is a style sheet language

q1.answer: CSS is the language used to style the HTML documents
q1.explanation: CSS is a style sheet language that stands for Cascading Style Sheet and is used to style HTML documents. CSS is mainly designed to separate the presentation and content, including layout, colors, and fonts.

q2.question: Which of the following tag is used to embed css in html page?
q2.explanation: <style> </style> tag is used to embed CSS in HTML page, while <script> </script> is used to embed JS in HTML. <!DOCTYPE html> is HTML5 declaration.

q3.question: Which of the following CSS selectors are used to specify a group of elements?

q4.question: Which of the following type of HTML tag is used to define an internal style sheet?
q4.explanation: <style> tag is used to define an internal style sheet in HTML document.

q5.question: Which of the following CSS property is used to make the text bold?
q5.explanation: The font-weight property is used for setting the thickness and boldness of the font. It is used to define the weight of the text. The available weight depends on the font-family, which is used by the browser.
